subject: Personal Finance
title: Why We Trust Coins
description: A 60-second lesson on Why We Trust Coins.

hook.text: A coin is just a disk of metal. So why does everyone accept it as valuable?

buildup.text: Coins carry an implicit promise from the issuer â€” usually a king or government.

discovery.text: The stamp on a coin says 'I guarantee this weight and purity.' Trust is literally stamped in.

twist.text: When rulers broke that promise by debasing coins, entire economies crumbled.

climax.text: Money has always been a story about trust. The metal is just the medium for the message.

punchline.text: Money works because we believe it does.

quiz.question: What gives a coin its value?
options: The trust in the issuer's guarantee
The weight of the metal alone
